title: Senior Product Manager - Partners/Merchants
description:
As a Senior Product Manager for our partner ecosystem at Mudflap, you’ll influence a market-leading mobile and web based product used daily by tens of thousands of SMB trucking companies. These customers serve as the backbone of the U.S. economy by transporting trillions of dollars of goods that touch every American. You will be responsible for managing Mudflap’s partner products that span the merchant ecosystem and helping us expand into new categories. Successful candidates will have a history of managing products from ideation to launch and then helping to grow them into market leaders.    

In the role, you will: 

-Be the expert on the needs and profiles of our merchant partners, leading the efforts in growing the partnership base and expanding into different verticals
-Identify and translate complex partner challenges into an exciting and innovative product strategy and roadmap, and manage partner integrations
-Define product requirements and drive product development in line with established success criteria
-Collaborate with Engineering, Design, Business Development and Customer Success to successfully execute the product strategy
-Manage the entire product lifecycle for our partner segment from ideation to launch and be accountable for on-going success criteria and OKRs

You have:

-Product management experience on high-impact products during a time of significant user growth
-Ability to understand market opportunities and help to open up the opportunity to adapt modern technology for audiences who may not be as familiar with it
-Resourcefulness to get things done quickly, function independently, think strategically and prioritize in a highly ambiguous environment to solve difficult technical challenges
-Empathy–deliver outcomes that make customers’ lives better, and the mindset that the best products are built through collaboration. You are a strong advocate for the brand and for the customer. You relentlessly focus on taking an outside in approach to product management
-An ability to energize others into action. You collaborate effectively across the organization, building partnerships and advancing shared objectives
-Passion and eagerness to share the stories about your product with the rest of the team and across the industry 

Perks and Benefits (What we offer): 

-A flexible, remote-first company
-A team of talented individuals on a mission to change a $1 trillion industry for the better
-A high bar for quality and commitment to self-improvement 
-An open mind to new ideas and methodologies
-Competitive salary and benefit options
-Opportunities and support for massive career growth

Company overview (Who we are):

Mudflap is well-funded by top-tier venture investors, including QED, NFX and 500 Startups, and our core team hails from Goldman Sachs, Disney, American Express, Mastercard, Groupon, and Trucker Path, the #1 mobile app among truck drivers.

Here are the core values that we believe in and look for in new teammates:

-Put Customers First: We put our customers and partners at the center of everything we do.
-Be Curious: Have a learning mindset. Ask, wonder, dig, investigate. Share the joy of discovery.
-Sweat The Details: We create magical experiences by obsessing over every detail.
-Do The Right Thing: We operate with integrity and exercise good judgment, even if no one is watching.
-Find A Way: We push past roadblocks to get the best outcomes for our customers and our teammates.
-Own It: Show up prepared, be present, and make it count.

3 to 5 years of experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and related methodologies (Agile, Waterfall), Project Management, data integration, and production support for an enterprise system
3 to 5 years of experience working with relational databases including SQL Server and Oracle.   
The ability to develop complex SQL, stored procedures, and use of triggers
At least 5 years of experience with Microsoft technologies including .Net Framework, ASP.NET/MVC, Visual Studio, Team Foundation Services, Web Services (SOAP, REST), Windows Services, WPF/WinForms, MS365, MS Access
Strong programming experience and languages
Functional knowledge in any of the following areas: Financial/Accounting, HR/Payroll, or Criminal Justice concepts including case flow from creation through sentencing
Knowledge of non-relational DBs (Mongodb, OLAP)

Additionally, any of the following knowledge and experience is highly desirable:

Development in object-based languages (C#, Java)  
N-Tier application development and support
Data integration based on Web Services (SOAP, REST), SFTP, SQL Polling
Middleware service bus such as BizTalk, MuleSoft, SSIS
Microsoft SQL Server technologies such as SSIS, SSRS, Machine Learning Services, and SQL Server Management Studio
Troubleshooting and data analysis of complex software systems
Multi-platform application development and support (Linux and Microsoft)
Business object frameworks such as CSLA, Entity Framework
Cloud development and architecture technologies; AWS/Azure, Azure SQL data warehouse, Office 365, Dynamics, Docker or other container technologies, Dev/ops software, GitLab
Cloud Services/Web Hosting providers, WAF, Email Services, Registrars, DNS

Please Note: These positions are required to have access to Sheriff’s Office or Probation Department facilities or view data or work with information systems for these departments. This requires that a more extensive “Security Clearance” be performed after hire by the Sonoma County Sheriff’s Office. Successful completion of the probationary period will be contingent upon passing the security clearance, which includes a Live Scan fingerprint-based check of the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and Federal Bureau of Investigations (FBI) criminal records. If you are offered a position, which requires a security clearance, the job offer letter will clearly specify this as a condition of the probationary period.
 
Please note that ISD recognizes the new County Telework Policy, at this time these positions will work both remotely and on-site. Under direction of the department head, employees may work up to four days remotely per a week, though some positions may require more on-site presence.

title: Network Software Engineer - Network Protocols BGP, Sflow, geo
description:
Leading Internet backbone Hurricane Electric seeks a Network Software Engineer to work on several Internet network related software projects involving BGP, BGP flow spec, sflow, netflow, and global Internet routing analysis. These services will be composed of backend components that are operational or analytical and simple web interfaces as the front end.

To be considered for this position you must have past software engineering experience involving processing or creating any one or more of the following: 1) BGP route or flowspec announcements, 2) BGP routing table data, 3) sflow/netflow data, 4) a system that produced geoip data (not just a client that used geoip data).

Also you are expected to have a working knowledge of SQL as well as any other database languages you prefer to use depending on the situation.

Hurricane Electric's Internet backbone network connects to over 9200 networks in 45 countries.

Our customers are Internet companies and large Internet networks.

We develop and maintain tools for network engineers to use such as: http://bgp.he.net http://lg.he.net http://he.net/layer2 http://he.net/3d-map

Responsibilities:

    Write a simple web interface front end and a network protocol related (i.e. BGP, sflow, etc) back end for several different Network Software projects.

Requirements:

    2+ years software engineering involving BGP, BGP flowspec, and/or sflow/netflow
    4+ years software engineering
    Solid knowledge of UNIX and TCP/IP network fundamentals
    Practical knowledge of protocols such as: IPv6, ARP, DNS, DHCP, HTTP, SSH, SNMP
    Knowledge of C, Go, or Rust required (to be able to write low level code to speak or ingest BGP or sflow messages).
    Knowledge of PHP, Python, Ruby, Perl, or Javascript a plus.
    Because this is a programming job, there will be one or more reasonable coding assessments. We apologize in advance for needing you to do this, we get many applicants with a very wide range of experience and competency. You can't tell just by looking at somebody's degree or by their communication skills during an interview whether they can program.
    Must have prior work experience using SQL and Linux.
    2+ years of experience working directly or indirectly with networks in a 24x7 production environment a plus.
    Experience working directly or indirectly with Cisco, Juniper, Extreme/Brocade, or Arista routers and switches a plus.
    Hands-on experience with network diagnostic tools such as ping, traceroute, mtr, iperf, dig, and whois

    Must have a clean background and be drug-free

title: General Manager of Kids Coding School (South Bay)
description:
Who We Are
theCoderSchool South Bay is an after-school drop-off program for students ages 7 to 18 learning to code. We are the #1 after-school coding program in Silicon Valley with 55+ locations nationwide and growing. Our mission is to get kids coding, which instills a life-long confidence in technology and serves as an incredibly useful, creative skill.

theCoderSchool South Bay is looking for a passionate General Manager (GM) to grow our school to new heights! You will be the captain of your own ship and get the opportunity to:
  
    Grow a coding community of kids!
    Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the area.
    Meet and communicate with school teachers, PTA parents, and local businesses to create opportunities for kids to code.

The GM is the person in charge of the day-to-day operations and growing the school. The key responsibilities are to:
  
   Ensure students are having an engaging and productive learning experience.   
  Make families happy (via smooth operations: scheduling, customer service, staffing, etc.).   
  Grow the community (via Sales & Marketing activities and team culture).
  

Requirements
Candidates must be:
  
    Excited about coding for kids. You genuinely believe in our mission to get kids coding and have an easy time inspiring others to join the cause. Coding has impacted your life in a big way and you want to pay it forward to the next generation.
    Organized techie.  You have a natural sense of orderliness/organization and have a comfort of multitasking across multiple web applications (keep track of a complex schedule for hundreds of students, HR, events, sales & marketing processes using a myriad of web applications). You don’t need to know how to code but the idea of adopting new programs and platforms to streamline your work piques your curiosity.
    Driven.  You are excited by growing a business and are constantly figuring out ways to bring in new students.

  Experienced in CS & education. We can train you on how to hire and manage your technical coaches if you are not technical, but a technical and education (tutoring or the like) background to support the students learning experiences and even coach students several hours per week may be helpful.

Sound like a fun challenge?  Shoot us an email with a cover letter and resume!

title: Sr. Talend ETL Developer (Senior Application Development Analyst)
description:
JOB TITLE: Senior Application Development Analyst		

LOCATION: San Francisco or Sacramento

JOB OPENING #: 5540


OVERVIEW 
The Judicial Council of California is accepting applications for the position of Senior Talend ETL Developer (Senior Application Development Analyst) in the Administrative Systems Development unit of the Information Technology office. 

The Senior Talend ETL Developer will work with judicial branch architects, judicial branch data architects, judicial branch technical teams and external service providers to establish a shared service ETL platform that will be used by multiple teams throughout the agency. The SADA will provide leadership and vision in developing a shared service ETL platform that supports the multiple strategic data initiatives, improves data quality and standardization, and promotes reusability. The incumbent will also work closely with the business application team, end users, external service providers, and other teams to gather and understand extract, transform, and load requirements. From the defined requirements, the SADA will create technical designs, develop, and test the ETL processes.

Additionally, the SADA will work with judicial branch architects, judicial branch technical teams and external service providers to maintain and support the ETL platform. The SADA will identify and apply the patches and/or upgrades necessary to maintain technical viability and alignment with branch strategy and vision.

The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, up to $130 per month reimbursement for qualifying commuting costs, and retirement savings plans. In San Francisco, the office is only a 7-minute walk from the Civic Center BART station in downtown San Francisco. In Sacramento, the office is located minutes from downtown, just north of Discovery Park. 

The successful candidate will be expected to work in the San Francisco or Sacramento office. Hybrid (in-office/remote) schedule for 2022.


RESPONSIBILITIES 
ETL Process Requirements Analysis and Design
•	Take the lead to establish overall ETL practices and design standards and adhere to new and existing standards when designing solutions.
•	Work closely with the business application teams, end users, external service providers, enterprise architects, data architects and other teams to gather and understand ETL requirements.
•	Participate in data modeling and data mapping activities.
•	Identify and document any data governance issues that would need to be addressed.
•	Translate requirements into technical ETL requirements and process design specifications.
•	Review proposed ETL technical and design specifications and processes from other teams and provide feedback.
•	Consult with other teams regarding the architecture and usage of the ETL platform.
ETL Process Development
•	Develop or update database components (e.g., view/functions/procedures) needed to support ETL requirements.
•	Develop or update ETL processes for data exchanges that are needed to support requirements.
•	Perform unit testing ensuring that solutions meet business, performance, and technical requirements.
•	Perform performance testing ensuring solutions meet target performance goals; provide optimization and tuning as required.
•	Deploy ETL Processes per established change control processes and procedures.
•	Perform code-reviews to not only quality check the work of other developers, but to also have his/her work reviewed and checked for best practices.  These reviews also provide cross-training so that coverage is maintained.
Participate in Quality Assurance activities 
•	Create and maintain test plans, test cases, test scripts.
•	Participate in all aspects of systems testing, including system, regression, performance, and load testing.
•	Record test results: log and prioritize all issues identified during testing. Track issues through resolution.
Patch and Upgrade ETL platform 
•	Identify the need for ETL platform patching and upgrades based on product life cycle timelines, security vulnerabilities, alignment to strategic and tactical plans, and function/feature requirements.
•	Identify the impact of ETL platform patching and upgrades to the current environment.
•	Develop a detail upgrade/deployment plan, identifying the tasks, risks, resources, and dependencies.
•	Work in collaboration with the data architects, enterprise architects, technical teams, application teams, business teams, external service providers and other stakeholders, to complete the patching/upgrade tasks.
•	Perform regression testing to ensure there are not any negative impacts to the operations of the ETL platform due to the upgrades.  Coordinate User Acceptance Testing if needed.
•	Research and review new and emerging technology options.  Stay current on ETL technology platforms.
Production System Support of ETL Platform
•	Analyze and troubleshoot complex production problems. 
•	Apply fixes for issues by following design, development, test, and deployment cycle.
•	Provide daily monitoring of system processes, resources, and performance to ensure the ETL platform are operating effectively and that all required processes completed successfully.
•	Provide user access and privilege administration for the ETL platform.
Provide Complete, Current and Accurate Documentation
•	Create and update ETL best practices documentation.
Provide Clear and Accurate Communications regarding Assigned Work
Participate in Daily Stand-Up meetings to discuss progress and/or any roadblocks in the way of completing assignments.

Other Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Technical training for new and emerging technology.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree preferably in computer science, information systems, or directly related field, and five (5) years of design and development experience including solid knowledge and proficiency in the software used in the assignment. 

Possession of a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or directly related field may be substituted for one of the years of required experience. An additional four years of professional experience as noted above may substitute for the bachelor’s degree. Or, additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.

OR

One year as an Application Development Analyst (utilizing the software used in the assignment) with the Judicial Council of California or one year of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of an Application Development Analyst in a California Superior Court or California state-level government entity.

About UsAt Saildrone, we sustainably explore, map and monitor the oceans to understand, preserve, and protect our world. Saildrone designs and manufactures wind and solar powered autonomous surface vehicles called Saildrones, which make cost-effective ocean data collection possible at scale. We work with governments, civic agencies, foundations, universities, and private companies around the globe to drive better information about our oceans and seas - be it in sailing drones into the eye of a Category 4 hurricane to obtain new scientific storm data, mapping out the ocean floor, collecting new CO2 data in hard-to-reach areas, counting biomass to establish fishing quotas, or detecting and stopping illegal fishing and drug trafficking. As a result of our work, we have been selected as one of the "Forbes Top 10 Wonders of 2021", as well as the Smithsonian Institute's "Top 10 Ocean Stories of 2021", New York Times' "Top 21 Things that happened (for the first time) in 2021", and Popular Science's "100 Greatest Innovations of 2021". We are based in Alameda, CA, with offices in Washington DC and St. Petersburg, FL and operate our missions worldwide. We are backed by top-tier investors in the frontier-tech and sustainability sectors, including Social Capital, Capricorn, Lux Capital, BOND Capital, and Emerson Collective.This is an exciting opportunity with a fast-growing team at the cutting-edge intersection of big data services and autonomous hardware. You will be an integral part of a high-performing multi-disciplinary delivering high impact for humanity and future generations.The RoleYou will be responsible for designing and implementing software that runs onboard our Saildrones - to communicate over satellite comms, navigate the ocean as instructed by remote pilots, detect and avoid obstacles on the horizon, and control low level actuators that actually make this all possible. You’ll also work closely with sensor payloads onboard the vehicle - radar and camera systems, oceanographic and bathymetry sensor suites. Saildrones operate in the most challenging environment in the world: our fleet is solar and wind powered, and can be deployed for up to one year without returning to port. These challenges make efficient algorithms a must and require a clear focus on simulation and hardware-in-the-loop testing.Required Skills

Familiarity with protobuf

Experience with ocean science or bathymetry payloads.
